author: bergmeister
body:
cc @SteveL-MSFT 

# Steps to reproduce

Install MSIX v7 preview 5 from private preview in MS store. It appends its PATH variable BEFORE the already installed pwsh RTM installation, it should be AFTER it.
# Expected behavior

```pwsh
> where.exe pwsh
C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6\pwsh.exe
C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\Microsoft.PowerShellPreview_7.0.5.0_x64__8wekyb3d8bbwe\pwsh.exe
```

# Actual behavior

```pwsh
> where.exe pwsh
C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\Microsoft.PowerShellPreview_7.0.5.0_x64__8wekyb3d8bbwe\pwsh.exe
C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6\pwsh.exe
```

# Environment data

 MSIX v7 preview 5 from private preview in MS store.

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-Preview.5
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-Preview.5
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18362
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: There's nothing in the manifest manipulating PATH, this seems to be the behavior of AppX pkgs.  However, if I run `pwsh` from cmd, it still starts 6.2.3.

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body: You're right it does work in `cmd.exe` but when I execute `pwsh -version` in PowerShell 6.2.3, then it returns `PowerShell 7.0.0-Preview.5`, which is a no-go. Somehow this does not happen in PowerShell 5.1

comments.author: kilasuit
comments.body:
I don't get this in 6.2.3 or 5.1
however I get a nice random assortment as below

`5.1` returns `6.2.3` - expected
`6.2.3` returns `6.2.3`   - expected
`7p5 MSIX` returns `7.0.0.Preview.5` - expected
`7p5 MSI` returns `6.2.3`  - unexpected should return `7.0.0.preview.5` as should be on the

title: MSIX Preview package adds itself BEFORE the PATH variable of pwsh.exe therefore overriding it
